Reviews.Title: “An historic gem that feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: 2travelight
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed staying at this historic boutique hotel for over 2 weeks. We returned for a 2nd week because the staff are so friendly and make you feel completely at home. Also the quality and cleanliness of the rooms, and the delicious buffet breakfast, would normally be found in a more expensive hotel. Yusufpasa Konagi Hotel pays attention to detail and delivers a comfortable relaxed experience of a traditional historic home in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Particular-harbor
Reviews.Content: The tour group we booked with (One Nation) set up our hotel Istanbul and I was very pleased with their choice. The hotel is in the Sultanahmet walking distance to most of the major sights, train station and plenty of choices for restaurants and shops. The hotel staff was very helpful, and took time to talk about their language and culture. We stayed at the hotel on the front end and the back end of our trip and were in different rooms, I would recommend staying in a room that does not face the front of the hotel, there was much more noise from the train station (and a rooster that lives in front). Happy traveling

Reviews.Title: “It was beautiful stay!”
Reviews.Author: sarsur
Reviews.Content: This hotel was given to by my tour operator as a part of a 10 days tour. This hotel was the first what I saw in Istanbul and I really like it. It was very clean, nice service. Food was fine. The most what I like - is decoration inside (with a lot of old stuff) and outside of the hotel (wooden house). And it was a lot of flowers all around hotel. Also location of the hotel is perfect, just few minutes away from Blue Mosque. So I have enjoyed it a lot. I really advice this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really cute boutique hotel in an AMAZING location”
Reviews.Author: leivav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Istanbul for our honeymoon and stayed at this hotel. I am a sucker for all things historic, so staying in a boutique hotel that used to be a pasha's mansion was really fun for me. The architecture is so interesting, and I loved all of the details inside, especially the antiques they chose to display in the hallways and lobby. The rooms were kind of small and not very luxurious (but very clean and nice), so if you are looking for all of the comforts of a 5-star chain hotel, then you better stay somewhere else. This place has character and charm, though, and I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay someplace that was interesting, quiet, calm, and incredibly close to many major tourist attractions. The location is amazing. Situated in the heart of Sultanahmet area, it is about a 5-10 minute walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, and the Basilica Cistern. In fact, my husband and I would walk back to the hotel in between seeing sites to use the bathroom and rest for a little bit, so we would be fully energized to see the next place.

Reviews.Title: “Charmingly nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Hinke075
Reviews.Content: When you're in search for a hotel that makes you feel 'at home', then Yusufpasa konagi is the place to be. We experienced a very good service, the rooms are very handsome (in a local style) and for breakfest there's a range of (Turkish) bread, grilled vegetables, olives, yoghurt, cheese etc. Located nearby some of the greatest attractions of Istanbul (a.o. Topkapi palace, Aya Sofia, Yerebatan Sarnici, Grand Bazaar...) it deserves our recommendation! We'd like to thank the Manager for his helpfulness, at three o'clock in the morning, when our cab-driver dint't show up. So we catched our plane!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sreerupam
Reviews.Content: -Small but well appointed and clean rooms -Nice bathroom with hand made soap and a pouch of lavender, very nice touch - Well decorated communal areas - Helpful reception staff - Reasonable breakfast The only downside is the steep incline you have to negotiate to get to the main tourist area

Reviews.Title: “Charming, cozy, and well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrRigga
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our weekend stay in Istanbul perfect, despite the weather. We were picked up at the airport by the friendly staff of the hotel. The hotel is located in the charming Sultanahmet and within walking distance (10 minutes) of the Blue Mosques and the Topkapi Palace. The room was very small but clean and charming. The breakfast room felt like someone had invited us into their living room, nicely decorated and wonderful staff. Will definitely stay there on future visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: alisonsheridan
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights in Istanbul and would definitely recommend this hotel for its friendly staff and ideal location for exploring the historical sights in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Family-run hotel with great location and staff, and terrific value for money!”
Reviews.Author: DFHoppin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Yusufpasa Konigi for five nights with my cousins from Switzerland. Hotel is quirky in design but impeccable in service, excellent in location, and can't be beat for the price. Rooms were not huge but adquate, with modern bathrooms in which everything works. I cannot overstate how friendly and efficient the staff was throughout our stay, from front desk to housekeeping to restaurant/bar. Will definitely return to the Yusufpasa Konigi!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance & comfort, reception & neatness”
Reviews.Author: mandy-antigoni
Reviews.Content: Just came back. It's just today that we left this lovely hotel to return to Athens. No complains. Neat and cosy atmosphere, very elegant decoration, very clean room and really serviceable-helpful stuff .Too muck RakÄ± and sitting up late, didn't allow us to enjoy the breakfast more than once (which was today, just before leaving), but I have to say that there was satisfactory variety and fresh ingredients. I left satisfied and happy, thinking about the time of my return. I wish them luck and to keep up their wonderful work. Tekrar gÃ¶rÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼rÃ¼z...

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL BEDROOM AND VERY FRIENDLY STUFF!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sofia80corfugreece
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend at this hotel from 4 to 10 January. The moment we walked into our room i could not believe it! It was so beautiful,comfortable and nicely decorated! The buth tub was big and with a jacuzzi!!!!! It was perfect to use after so many hours walking! The water view was also unique! The hotel is situated in a quite neighboorhood and 5 minutes away from AGIA SOFIA,BLUE MOSQUE,BASILIKA CISTERN. You can use the tram to go to taksim and istiklal road(full of shops). The stuff in this hotel was very friendly and with a smile all time! AS for the breakfast they had olives,joghurt,milk,cookies,eggs,sausages,potatoes,salads,tea,coffee etc.The juice was the only thing i didnt like but ok! Everyday they have different things on buffet but when something is finished they dont bring more of it.I think if u go early in the morning you have everything!! Iam very satisfied that i stayed at this hotel!I reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “fine and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamPeter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Christmas time 2010. Good and helpful staff. Rooms are a bit on the small site and the hotel is a bit far from the nearest tramstop (but what a walk! passing Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia). Breakfast is great! Serkan is an eager and helpful 22 year old waiter who's attention you will enjoy. Yvonne & Piet Zaandijk Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel with super location”
Reviews.Author: Jasmina04
Reviews.Content: Super location, very good service with good breakfast and cozy ambient. would defenitely recommend this hotel in odl part of Istanbul. Perfect value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Value with a Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Braska
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing first time trip to Istanbul due in large part to this hotel. The room was clean with a great view and close to every site I wanted to visit. I never had to take a cab or even public transportation. The staff went above and beyond to be helpful. I was injured and needed to be brought to the hospital and the pharmacy for medicine. The driver and front desk staff made several trips with me and was unbelievably kind and helpful. The lovely front desk girl Derya was particularly helpful and friendly. You were treated like a long lost relative. I have traveled extensively through Cairo, Israel, Europe and North America and this was perhaps my best hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean, convenient hotel in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LivinginBoston
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel, but it is very nice, clean, comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful despite limited English. The hotel is in the heart of the Sultanahmet section of Istanbul - the Old City. It is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Ayasofia, the Hippodrome and many other sites. It was only a little further walk to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar and a short walk to the harbor area. The hotel was convenient to everything we wanted to see. And they arranged for transporation for other sites that were not within walking distance. We only ate breakfast there which was very good - fresh fruit, cereal, eggs, bread. Unless you are on one of the top floors and have a water view, there isn't much to look at in that area. It's away from the main Sultanahment streets so there isn't much of a view but it was very quiet at night. Didn't try the fish restaurant next door. There were too many dinner choices all over the area. It was a great location and the people were incredibly welcoming and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak53
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in the Yusufpasa Hotel when we decided to extend our stay in Istanbul and our other hotel was booked. What a fortuitous event! We loved everything about this lovely little spot. The location was ideal, close to everything and right around the corner from a street with dozens of restaurants and shops. The bathroom was beautiful, with a large step in shower, several bars of herbal soap, a loufa, toothpaste and toothbrush and plenty of towels. Our beds, were made up with the whitest of sheets and everything smelled freshly laundered and clean. The breakfast was ample with home-baked goodies, fruit, yogurt, dried fruit, cereals, breads etc. There were also the typical Turkish items of cheese, olives, tomatoes, meats etc. The lobby and breakfast room are decorated with so many lovely pieces of Turkish arts and crafts, from punched tin to pottery, porcelain, Ottoman style wooden furniture...everything went together to make for a welcoming and comfortable stay. There was even a small bowl with some pieces of Turkish Delight candies on the nightstand. I would highly recommend this hotel and only regret that we were able to stay just one night there. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: hobokenkitchen
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel!! We booked this hotel through Heritage Travel in Cappadocia for 1 night before flying out to our next destination. We had already stayed in Istanbul for 4 nights at the Alaturka which I had spent a lot of time researching, but they were full. Now I'm happy they were as We just loved the Yusuf Pasa. They were so friendly from check in to check out with a complimentary glass of fresh squeezed lemonade on arrival which was a welcome refreshment after our flights. Our room was marvelous with a king size bed and sweeping views of the Bosphorus - better views than we had paid extra for at the Alaturka dare I say. Bathroom was also great. The front desk spent a lot of time trying to help us untangle the web that was our international flight booking and were charming and friendly throughout. Breakfast was also good. All in all we were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with good rate”
Reviews.Author: cjao1974
Reviews.Content: They have very good service, not only with the room rate but also kindly, friendly. the room is clean and neat with AC and free internet. It is good for business here. The location is good, it is easy to take tran and also easy to transfer by boat to Asia side.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, ideally clean”
Reviews.Author: ThemisKatsimichas
Reviews.Content: This hotel lies just five minutes walk from major sites like St. Sophia and the Blue Mosque, in the Old town (Sultanahmet district). It is very clean and quiet at night (though not totally soundproof between rooms and the street outside) and the staff at the front desk is very friendly. It needs a bit work when it comes to breakfast, as there is limited choice and it gets boring after a couple of days. Right next to it is a very 'hot' with the city's upper class fish restaurant, also referred in the Lonely Planet guide, relatively cheap for a European. All in all a very nice hotel for a few days stay right in the middle of everything (sightseeingwise).

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent”
Reviews.Author: GenkiSaraChan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of the best value and welcoming hotels I've ever stayed in. Myself and partner stayed here in at the beginning of the month for 5 nights and had a great experience. The staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough for us - to the extent of writing a list of Turkish words with English meaning when we showed an interest in picking up some useful phrases! They booked restaurants for us on request, gave us a free transfer back to the airport (a one way transfer from the airport was included in the price but we didn't fly to Ataturk) and constantly put themselves out to be friendly and show an interest in talking to us. The room was exceptionally clean, of reasonable size (double standard room) with a lovely modern bathroom. The wardrobe was spacious and the bed was very comfortable and bigger than standard. The breakfast was more than adaquate with eggs, salad, cold meats, bread, fresh fruit, pastries, cereal etc!! The window for breakfast wad good aswell - 7pm - 10pm, so we were not limited to having to get up early to have this! The location was also wonderful, situation in Sultanamhet - just a short distance from Blue Mosque and all the other wonderful sights of Istanbul. There was also a tram stop 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel to go over the bridge to places like Beloglu - so very conveniently situated. We were really glad we stayed in Sultanamhet as public transport in Istanbul was really convenient and cheap. To sum up, Yusufpasa Konagi Hotel was excellent value for money and added to our first experience of visiting Istanbul. Thank you to the staff who made our stay here so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mira2010
Reviews.Content: A small, boutique hotel located a very short walk from Ayasofia and the Blue Mosque in the heart of Istanbul's old city. The hotel is an old, beautifully restored residence appointed with many lovely antiques. Each room has a very modern, private bath. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast, included with a night's lodging, was very plentiful, delicious, and included both traditional Turkish and European choices. The hotel is nestled in a vibrant neighborhood amongst traditional residences, small shops, many wonderful restaurants and other boutique hotels, thus giving the traveler a truly authentic experience.

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: NaneSG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the frrendly attitude of the staff, the large room with a fantastic sea view from the 4fl and the cleanliness of the place. We regretted it did not have a roof terrace cafe or restaurant, but there are plenty others who do have in the area. We would highly recommend it for a short stay since it is within walking distance from many of Istambul' s highlights and next door to a fabulous restaurant. CARMEN & jOEL Ferney Voltaire, France, April 2010

Reviews.Title: “Yusufpasa a place to stay Ä±n the hart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: georg_thaler
Reviews.Content: CommÄ±ng the fÄ±rst tÄ±me to a new cÄ±ty Ä±s always a great experÄ±ence. The sÄ±ze of Istanbul Ä±s amazÄ±ng, the culture, the people, the places you can vÄ±sÄ±t. I stayed Ä±n the Yusufpasa Hotel for a week. It was my fÄ±rst tÄ±me here, but Ä±t wÄ±ll not be the last. Its verry close (5 mÄ±nutes walk) to the most Ä±mportant sÄ±tes lÄ±ke HagÄ±a SophÄ±a, Blue Mosqe, TopkapÄ± palace, the amazÄ±ng CÄ±sternes .... . The rooms are verry clean (especÄ±aly the bathroom), staff Ä±s absolutley frendly and helpfull wÄ±th any questÄ±on. I can absoluty recommend the Yusufpasa for any trÄ±pp to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: mianbob
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport by the hotel van, but due to a car rally being held in Istanbul, streets were blocked off to the access to the hotel. Our driver parked us on one side of the barricade, a car from the hotel met us on the other side and we were whisked up to our hotel. Staff were very welcoming. Our room was very large, with a comfortable bed. Furnishings were of very good quality and the room had a very classy decor. We had a view of the Bosporus and could watch the many ships going by. Great breakfast included in very reasonable room rate. The hotel is about 4 blocks from the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace--easy walking distance, although uphill. Many restaurants are available in the surrounding area. About a 10 minute walk to the tram which is a main link throughout Istanbul--note: get a pocketful of Turkish lire coins (five Euros worth) , simplest way to use buses, trams, and ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic estate in the heart of ancient Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EastCoast2WestCoast
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helped out directions around the city. The restaurant upstairs has a magnificent view of the sea and Istanbul. Very clean place, service was great! I loved the design and decoration of the lobby. It's full of Ottoman furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel ,Service,Room,Staff,”
Reviews.Author: arestours
Reviews.Content: Thanks For all.We we recomend everybody.When you go Ä°stanbul Sultanahmet area ;You must stay this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Exstasis
Reviews.Content: it's a great hotel which has very good location and clean rooms. highly recommended. it offers special campaigne for a limited time, 19 euro per night, and it's above the price and expection

Reviews.Title: “good location + friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: masumeLondon
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a basic breakfast but it is good value for its location and very friendly staff. Rooms are clean but the lights are very dull and could do with a good spring clean. There are big signs saying you cant leave any food or drink in your room. Which is a bit annoying as you may wish to leave a bottle of water/ fruit etc. we arrived at 0930 for breakfast only to find it was all being cleared away. the lovely waiter said there had been an error and proceeded to bring back all the breakfast things and even boiled me an egg! An elderly gentleman arrived 15 minutes later and he too got a good service even tho he had missed the end of breakfast. So what is the criticism? Breakfast is poor quality. No blankets in rooms. pillows not so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location good 3 star hotel to discover old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jpver
Reviews.Content: This hotel situated in Sultanahmet the old centre of Istanbul is an honest choice to discover Istanbul during a few days. From the outside the older building is perfectly restored. The staff at the reception is friendly and helpful. It is a 3 star hotel. The rooms are not the biggest ones, but they are clean, comfortable and the bathroom is correct. There is a small fridge in the room. There is an elevator, on the top roof there is a restaurant that we only used for the breakfast buffet, which is honest, and you have a nice view on the Bosporus in the morning sun. Positive points: The major quality is the geographical situation. You are really at short walking distance from the major places in the old city centre: Topkapi, Aya Sophia, the Bleu Mosque, the Yerebatan Citterns, etc. But also the Sultanahmet quarter itself is quite nice to walk through and there are plenty of restaurants. The tramway system connecting to the metro system is at 10 minutes walk. It is an ideal place to discover old Istanbul. You do not have the hassle to take taxis, drive around etc. Only if you have already seen this part then you could take other options. We used the hotel a few days before our departure of a cruise. A taxi to the Cruise terminal is not expensive as it is just across the bridge. Negative points: well not really, just the size of the room, but this is definitely not a â€œshowstopperâ€� Conclusion: excellent well situated 3 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and firendly staff, top location”
Reviews.Author: hafrsfjord
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with out teenage daughter and her friend. The staff was very helpfull and gave us a room when we arrived 8 in the mornig, with the bus from south. Breakfast at the top floor terrace was very good, and the view matched the food. The pictures do not reflect how nice it is to have breakfast looking out on Bosporos at their resturant. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAriel
Reviews.Content: From our modest room, we could see the lighthouse, the Bosporus, old city walls, and a patio full of happy Istanbul cats. Best location in the city, next door to Hagie Sophia and Blue Mosque, great views from terrace, clean room, helpful staff, we completely enjoyed it. Free ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “What is there to complain?”
Reviews.Author: TrippedFeet
Reviews.Content: OK, maybe this hotel is a little bit down a hill, but even unfit person like me - and when I say unfit I mean a short flight of staircases, will make me gasp for oxygen (yes I am that unfit!!) - this is a pleasant walk up. With all the delicious dondurmas you'll be gulping don't you need some means of burning those extra calories? Moreover, this hotel is actually the closest place to go to TopKapi Palace. As soon as you stepped out from the hotel take a left and walk straight along the quiet street without turning left again to go up that hill. Going up the hill will bring you to the restaurants, carpet shops and others things which you know what that'll mean. Not that I don't enjoy being where the action is, I just don't like saying 'No' to hopeful faces. The staff are friendly and even if some of them do not speak good english but sometimes all you need is a smile to feel at home. I actually broke the curtain (pls dont ask me how) on my last day and prepared to pay for it, but one of the staff went and checked and said to me the internationally recognised magic word " No Problem!!' The terrace has view over the sea, the breakfast in my standard were the most decent compared to all the hotels I stayed throughout Turkey and they have really charming lobby that itself like a mini museum since they have some antiques on display. Good wireless connection and is free. I really can't remember a thing that I wasn't happy about.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy atmosphere, hÄ±storÄ±c ,Ä±nsÄ±de up to modern standard,Ä±deal locatÄ±on”
Reviews.Author: PipoMarbella
Reviews.Content: I booked our 5 day stay by Ä±nternet and found the Yusuf Pasha KonaghÄ± even more charmÄ±ng Ä±n realÄ±ty ! The hall area Ä±s so Ä±nvÄ±tÄ±ng that you feel at home at once and the room was excellent : 5 wÄ±ndows wÄ±th dÄ±fferent vÄ±ews towards the sea, a mÄ±nÄ± terrace, everythÄ±ng very clean, very frÄ±endly and helpful staff lÄ±ke Cafer, the evenÄ±ng receptÄ±on manager , who takes a personal Ä±nterest Ä±n advÄ±sÄ±ng you how to make the most of your stay Ä±n Istambul. -Breakfast Ä±s excellent : good varÄ±ety and qualÄ±ty ( thanks to the nÄ±ce lady attendant for gettÄ±ng out the homemade lemon jam! DelÄ±cÄ±ous!). Each day I have enjoyed the specÄ±al locatÄ±on of the restaurant beÄ±ng Ä±n the upper floor wÄ±th wonderful sea vÄ±ews so you can watch the shÄ±ps go by whÄ±le lÄ±stenÄ±ng to VÄ±valdÄ± and melancholÄ±c TurkÄ±sh tunes. - Also the locatÄ±on of the hotel Ä±s Ä±deal: Ä±n a quÄ±et street , yet near popular street restaurants , wÄ±thÄ±n 5 mÄ±nutes walkÄ±ng to the sea, to TopkapÄ± Palace, Haya SophÄ±a , Blue Mosque and tram. Only 10 mÄ±nutes walkÄ±ng down to the ferrÄ±es at EmÄ±nonÃ¼ , the EgytÄ±an Bazar....- I wÄ±ll certaÄ±nly come back and also recommend Ä±t to any traveler wÄ±th an Ä±ndÄ±vÄ±dual taste!

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: hsh41
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation just few hours before getting there so we got a small room for the first night . Next morning we were moved to a very pleasant room . Breafast is very nice , location is great and stuff is very friendly ( hi Jaffar .. ) the whole dill was excellent - we paid 210 $ for 3 nights double room , I will surely be back .

Reviews.Title: “Solid and pleasant tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankgarrison
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yusufpasa Konagi from October 20th through the 23rd while in town for the Fenerbahce v. Arsenal match. The hotel is a good, solid tourist hotel. The room was clean, the hot water plentiful and the towels nice and fluffy. My room looked over an alley and, thus, the view was not anything to brag about, but the rooftop restaurant (which offered a free breakfast) had a nice view. The staff was very friendly, helpful and accomodating. All clerks spoke at least a little English. There was a free internet station in the lobby and the entire hotel had free wireless (get code from front desk). Most of the main tourist sites were within reasonably easy walking distance but be warned you must negotiate a small but steep hill to get to the main areas of Sultanahmet. Only complaint was the free hotel transfer I used to get to the airport for my departure. The driver was late, then he ran out of gas!! Quite a close call getting to the airport on time. To his credit, after the car ran out of gas, the driver did flag a taxi and pay for the taxi to get me to the airport. Also, had i asked for the transfer to arrive a half-hour or hour earlier, I could have avoided this.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Babs81Rovereto
Reviews.Content: It's a nice, simple hotel in an excellent location if you want to visit the main sites in Istanbul. Only a few minutes walk from Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The hotel is close to a lively street, with lots of restuarants and bars but at the same time is slightly away from it, so I found it quite quiet.The rooms are basic but equipped with everything you need (mini fridge, air conditioning). Breakfast is served on the top floor where you have a beautiful view of the sea. The reception staff was very nice and helpful. For example, they immediately replaced the hairdryer which broke while I was using it. They're also pleased to help you calling taxis or booking restaurants for you.

Reviews.Title: “Yusuf pasa hotel was excellent experience to stay specially the freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sohail2
Reviews.Content: Yusuf Pasa Konagi is very well suitated close to historical places. It is very convient and suitable for short stay specially for planned historical sightseeing. Close to all transportation. Hotel have nice resturant at 4th floor with beautiful view of the sea. The lobby is okay equipment with antique items and furniture. Hotel has very pleasant and helpful staff specially "Ms Burcu Cayir" at the receiption, she is charming and ready to help the guests with their needs. She is really an asset to the hotel. Will definately stay there again during next travel.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is not what you get”
Reviews.Author: traveler1357246
Reviews.Content: I could not believe the difference between the website and how the "hotel" looks in reality. It is like the photos were takes 20 years ago when the place was new. This is a total froud. Room is dark, small, old. The restaurant downstairs makes a lot of noise and smell is all over. Service is bad and not welcoming. Except for the location, there is nothing in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: noelm
Reviews.Content: During a recent 3-week trip to Turkey I spent 5 nights at one of the nicest hotels I've ever experienced. The Hotel Yusuf Pasa Konagi is perfectly located in the old section of Istanbul, Sultanahmet, an easy stroll away from the Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia church, Topkapi Palace and the unforgettable Grand Bazaar with its 4,000 shops. After a long days sightseeing it was always great to come home to this welcoming hotel. The staff are superb and go out of their way to help you. My beautifully furnished room was like a small suite with a large and extremely comfortable bed, a seperate sitting area with a table and 2 chairs and some rooms also have a small balcony. The included breakfast on the rooftop terrace with views of the Sea of Marmara was a treat. A special feature of this hotel, a fully-restored timber Ottoman mansion, is the lobby. It's like a mini museum beautifully drecorated with lots of interesting Turkish artifacts. During my time in Turkey I stayed in 8 hotels and the Yusuf Pasa Konagi outshone them all. The rates are great - check them out, Noel Marchiandi Surfers Paradise, Qld. Australia 4217

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: TripAdviseeYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel from reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. It wasn't our first choice but they had rooms available and it had received some excellent reviews. It was our first trip to Istanbul and we went for a week. I don't have experience of any other hotels in Turkey so can't compare. But here's some impressions- It's in a quiet back street at the southern end of Sultanahmet. The area was peaceful and quiet although rundown with several derelict abandoned buildings close by. The hotel does look like the picture. It's an old timber construction which has been recently renovated. There's a primary school just down the street, although this was not intrusive in any way - in fact the sound of the kids playing in the schoolyard was just about the only thing you would hear most mornings. It's convenient. Just a short walk to the Blue Mosque and the other main attractions. The room was small. Not big enough to sit in. It had one tiny wardrobe/closet. It was cool and quiet. We felt the need of somewhere to sit and read or have a drink at the end of a long day. There is a lounge area by the lobby. It was always deserted. We would have liked somewhere outdoors but there was nowhere suitable. They put a couple of chairs out on the pavement sometimes but they were only in the sun briefly in the mornings. There was no open rooftop terrace. Breakfasts were OK but exactly the same every day. Bread, cheese, boiled eggs, tomato, olives, spam-type meats/salami, cereals, yogurt. The last couple of days there was water melon but apart from that there was no fresh fruit at all. Some kind of reconstituted fruit juice which we didn't like. Apart from breakfast and the mini bar there was no other refreshments or food available. I think they occasionally opened the breakfast room as a restaurant or for other functions. I assume this is the Dilkes restaurant mentioned on the site - but it was never open when we were there. Overall I felt it was OK but I am not as enthusiastic as some other reviewers. We paid 184 lira per night (double room) - which included a 15% long stay discount. They provided free airport pick up and drop off.

Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a very quiet neighborhood right in the middle of all the action. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean. They aimed to please! I would most definitely stay there again.
